name: flat plate solar collector production, Cu absorber | flat plate solar collector, Cu absorber | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2226/documentation

The flat plate collector has selective black chrome coating on copper made in the US. ;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



Production and disposal of a flat plate collector in Switzerland. Including materials, water and energy use of production.
category: C:Manufacturing/28:Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c./281:Manufacture of general-purpose machinery/2815:Manufacture of ovens, furnaces and furnace burners

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Material data have been investigated for a collector produced in 2002. Data for energy uses during production have been investigated for 2001.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Production in CH. Main components are imported from the US. The glass is coated in DK.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Assembly of a flat plate collector. The collector has a copper sheet coated by black chrome coating.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Energy uses during production investigated in an other factory.
